docs.snippet: Goucher College will inaugurate this fall an experimental program in elementary teacher training, leading to a master of education degree. To encourage graduates of liberal arts colleges to enter the teaching profession, twenty fellowships have been...
docs.lead_paragraph: Goucher College will inaugurate this fall an experimental program in elementary teacher training, leading to a master of education degree. To encourage graduates of liberal arts colleges to enter the teaching profession, twenty fellowships have been made available through financial help from the Ford Fund for the Advancement of Education.

headline.main: EDUCATION NOTES; Varied Activities on the Campus And in the Classroom

docs.snippet: The trip to all the South American countries on which Dr. Milton Eisenhower started yesterday is much the most important move yet made by the new Administration in the field of inter-American affairs. It is not that the President's brother can...
docs.lead_paragraph: The trip to all the South American countries on which Dr. Milton Eisenhower started yesterday is much the most important move yet made by the new Administration in the field of inter-American affairs. It is not that the President's brother can himself do anything specific or make policy, since that will not be his role.

docs.snippet: ATLANTIC CITY, June 25 -- Leaders of the railroad industry of North and South America were told here today that one of the more important problems confronting the railroad electrical engineers is how to produce enough current to supply the increasing...
docs.lead_paragraph: ATLANTIC CITY, June 25 -- Leaders of the railroad industry of North and South America were told here today that one of the more important problems confronting the railroad electrical engineers is how to produce enough current to supply the increasing number of electric-powered devices incorporated in modern railroad cars.

docs.snippet: GENEVA, June 26 -- The Governing Body of the International Labor Organization ruled today that legislation in force in Czechoslovakia concerning trade unions is "contrary to the principle of freedom of the association."
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, June 26 -- The Governing Body of the International Labor Organization ruled today that legislation in force in Czechoslovakia concerning trade unions is "contrary to the principle of freedom of the association."
docs.abstract: ILO governing body backs plan to urge govts using forced labor systems to re-examine their laws in light of UN standards; rejects charges that Trieste and Uruguay curb unionization; defers action on Morocco

docs.snippet: Foreign exchange market continued on the dull side through another week of indecisive movement on the part of any of the major exchanges. British pound sterling and the Canadian dollar moved within a fractional range on limited orders that were made...
docs.lead_paragraph: Foreign exchange market continued on the dull side through another week of indecisive movement on the part of any of the major exchanges. British pound sterling and the Canadian dollar moved within a fractional range on limited orders that were made to fill only necessary requirements.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 28 (UP) -- Stockmen who pressed the Government for higher wool tariffs and relaxed grazing regulations on national forests will have to settle -- temporarily, at least -- for a lot less than they wanted.

docs.snippet: PARIS, July 3 -- The full application of the United States loyalty investigation program to United States citizens employed by the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization was left in doubt today after a general conference of...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, July 3 -- The full application of the United States loyalty investigation program to United States citizens employed by the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization was left in doubt today after a general conference of the educational group voted a compromise resolution on the subject.
